verses.text: And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When either man or woman shall separate \add themselves\add* to vow a vow of a Nazarite, to separate \add themselves\add* unto the \sc Lord\sc*:

he shall separate \add himself\add* from wine and strong drink, \add and\add* shall drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of strong drink, neither shall he drink any liquor of grapes, nor eat moist grapes, or dried.
All the days of his separation shall he eat nothing that is made of the vine tree, from the kernels even to the husk.

All the days of the vow of his separation there shall no rasor come upon his head: until the days be fulfilled, \add in\add* the which he separateth \add himself\add* unto the \sc Lord\sc*, he shall be holy, \add and\add* shall let the locks of the hair of his head grow.
All the days that he separateth \add himself\add* unto the \sc Lord\sc* he shall come at no dead body.
He shall not make himself unclean for his father, or for his mother, for his brother, or for his sister, when they die: because the consecration of his God \add is\add* upon his head.
All the days of his separation he \add is\add* holy unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And if any man die very suddenly by him, and he hath defiled the head of his consecration; then he shall shave his head in the day of his cleansing, on the seventh day shall he shave it.
And on the eighth day he shall bring two turtles, or two young pigeons, to the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:

and the priest shall offer the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, and make an atonement for him, for that he sinned by the dead, and shall hallow his head that \add same\add* day.

And he shall consecrate unto the \sc Lord\sc* the days of his separation, and shall bring a lamb of the first year for a trespass offering: but the days that were before shall be lost, because his separation was defiled.
And this \add is\add* the law of the Nazarite, when the days of his separation are fulfilled: he shall be brought unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation:

and he shall offer his offering unto the \sc Lord\sc*, one he lamb of the first year without blemish for a burnt offering, and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish for a sin offering, and one ram without blemish for peace offerings,
and a basket of unleavened bread, cakes \add of\add* fine flour mingled with oil, and wafers of unleavened bread anointed with oil, and their meat offering, and their drink offerings.
And the priest shall bring \add them\add* before the \sc Lord\sc*, and shall offer his sin offering, and his burnt offering:

and he shall offer the ram \add for\add* a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the \sc Lord\sc*, with the basket of unleavened bread: the priest shall offer also his meat offering, and his drink offering.

And the Nazarite shall shave the head of his separation \add at\add* the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall take the hair of the head of his separation, and put \add it\add* in the fire which \add is\add* under the sacrifice of the peace offerings.

And the priest shall take the sodden shoulder of the ram, and one unleavened cake out of the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and shall put \add them\add* upon the hands of the Nazarite, after \add the hair of\add* his separation is shaven:

and the priest shall wave them \add for\add* a wave offering before the \sc Lord\sc*: this \add is\add* holy for the priest, with the wave breast and heave shoulder: and after \add that\add* the Nazarite may drink wine.

This \add is\add* the law of the Nazarite who hath vowed, \add and of\add* his offering unto the \sc Lord\sc* for his separation, besides \add that\add* that his hand shall get: according to the vow which he vowed, so he must do after the law of his separation.
And the \sc Lord\sc* spake unto Moses, saying,
Speak unto Aaron and unto his sons, saying, On this wise ye shall bless the children of Israel, saying unto them,
The \sc Lord\sc* bless thee, and keep thee:
The \sc Lord\sc* make his face shine upon thee, and be gracious unto thee:
The \sc Lord\sc* lift up his countenance upon thee, and give thee peace.
And they shall put my name upon the children of Israel; and I will bless them.
